title: Sands Of Time
opening: Ninian is dead. Now, only Nergal's echoing laughter remains… On Hector's advice, the group heads toward Ostia. They are weary to the bone, and they need time to regroup. Ostia is the most heavily guarded fortress city in all of Lycia. No enemy should have been able to breach its walls.

battle.speaker: Denning
battle.line: This is a message from Lord Nergal. “I await you on the Dread Isle.”

battle.speaker: Hector
battle.line: Tell all the soldiers!! Take your posts, and don’t move. Hold your positions! All we can do is hold on until reinforcements arrive!!

battle.speaker: Eliwood
battle.line: I’m fine... I’m not that weak.

battle.speaker: Soldier
battle.line: You! You’re one of Lord Hector’s guests, aren’t you? You shouldn’t be out here, it’s too dangerous! Go and hide in that room! Do you understand?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Lord Hector! We’re pleased to see you home alive and well!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Where’s my brother?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Ah... He departed yesterday for a conference in Etruria. He’s scheduled to return in a half month’s time.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: ...Etruria? That’s a pity. Go and prepare rooms for my companions. They need rest.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Yes, my lord.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: My brother’s away... Oswin, did you know about this?

intro.speaker: Oswin
intro.line: Uh... Yes, I was aware of his trip.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Why did he choose to go to Etruria now? I don’t get it. It’s not like him.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Graybeard, you know something, don’t you? Tell me! What are we supposed to do now?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: A moment, lad... Yes, I suppose you’ve a right to know...... I first met Nergal some 500 years ago, wandering the Nabata wasteland. Like me, his only drive was the search for truth in this world. We were equals in power and knowledge, and we became fast friends. We believed we could solve the mysteries of the world. We truly believed...

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: So what happened?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: A...disagreement, made at the height of our quest. One day, as I charted the mysteries of Nabata, I came across the most amazing village... It was unbelievable, but in that place, humans and dragons lived together in cooperation.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Dragons and humans? Are you telling me they could live together in peace?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: At first, I doubted what my own eyes showed me. But yes, the village truly did exist.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: That’s... ...amazing.

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: The dragons that I beheld there... They were both similar to and different from the dragons I had fought hundreds of years before.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: ...Ah! Eliwood...are you...

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: ...... Please go on...

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: ...As you wish. They had refused to fight humans in the war, and instead, they retreated to this wasteland. They desired nothing but to remain hidden from the outside. Nergal and I crafted a barrier and created an oasis for them. Upon their invitation, we lived there with them. Our life there... It was calm and satisfying. At some point, the village became known as Arcadia, a place of perfect peace for travelers gone astray.

intro.speaker: Eliwood
intro.line: Arcadia...

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: The dragons’ libraries were a dream come true to us. We studied their language and history with unbridled passion. A century, then two... Time passed in an eye’s blink. And yet, slowly, our thoughts turned down different paths.

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: In what way?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: I wanted to share the dragons’ wisdom with others. My hope was for our earthly paradise to spread outward.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: And Nergal?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: Ah, Nergal... He took the dragons’ knowledge... He learned the art of stealing the essence from living creatures and turning it into power. ...It was terrible. When we discovered what he was doing, the elders and I tried to persuade him to stop. But the power bewitched him, and he was deaf to our pleas. He started with small creatures and grew ever more confident. Then, he began draining the quintessence of humans. The villagers and I joined forces and...defeated him. Or so we thought, but...

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: After he was banished from Arcadia, Nergal fled to Bern. He increased his power slowly to avoid our eye. Using quintessence, he made his puppets, the morphs. They’re bewitching in form, with intellects beyond human. I’m sure you’ve laid eyes on them yourselves. Jet black hair, pale complexion, and blood-red lips... Their most striking features are their glittering gold eyes.

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: Attack! We’re under attack!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: What!?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: L-Lord Hector! It’s bad! An unknown group has breached the castle walls!!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: How did they get in the castle without anyone noticing them!?

intro.speaker: Soldier
intro.line: They just appeared out of nowhere! The attack was so sudden, the castle guards were annihilated!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Castle Ostia is famed far and wide as being impregnable... If it’s been breached so easily, can we save it!?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: It’s Nergal. His magic created an entrance for his thugs within the castle.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Blast! That arrogant– No matter what, the throne must be protected! I’ll not let the castle fall while my brother’s away!!

intro.speaker: Lyn
intro.line: Hold on, Hector! I’m going with you!

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Mark! We need you! We need a plan!! If we can hold them back for a while, reinforcements will come!

end.speaker: Soldier
end.line: Lord Hector! Are you unharmed!? Protect Lord Hector! Knights of Ostia! Attack!!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Hey Graybeard! Are these guys...

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Yes, I’m sure of it. They are his morphs...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: It’s true... They’re all eerily similar. That reminds me... That man on Valor, Ephidel... Black Fang’s Sonia, too... Are you saying that he made them all?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: It is an abomination. A crime against all that is natural. When Nergal began using morphs to carry out his plans, his power had grown beyond our ability to contain him. After humans, his next target became the essence of dragons. His next target had to be Arcadia. I concealed our paradise behind a curtain of sandstorms. I then hid in the underground ruins and waited for him. I did not hope to defeat him. Just to exchange blows... and then draw him into the desert, which would be his end.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: But Nergal never showed up, did he?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Correct. I’ve no idea how he managed it but... He called those siblings through the Dragon’s Gate. And now... he plans to call a horde of dragons to this land.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What do we have to do to stop him?

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Our last hope is the power of the legendary items. It would take too long for us to gather all of them. I will go to the Shrine of Seals and tell Bramimond everything. We must have his power, no matter the cost.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Then we should go to the Dragon’s Gate ahead of you.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: What!?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: That’s a good idea. Even though you cannot harm Nergal himself, you can certainly do some damage to his troops.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: If we don’t answer Nergal’s invitation soon... He’ll continue to send out troops after us. If that’s going to happen, we might as well take the fight to him! I won’t have Lycia ravaged by any more of his acts!

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: ...You... You truly are Roland’s children. I am old... I did not expect anything to surprise me again, and yet...

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: ...Lord Athos.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: It takes the strongest of bonds to alter the course of fate. Go... Go, my youthful friends. Set your sights on the Dragon’s Gate and keep moving. ...Eliwood, Hector, where are the legendary items?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: They’re right here.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Mine, too. I’m sorry. ...I simply couldn’t bring myself to wield it.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Neither could I... Eliwood said it felt like Durandal moved by itself. A weapon with a will of its own? Can I really control a weapon like that? Frankly, I wasn’t sure.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Let me take them from you for a while. May I?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Yes.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: It’s fine, but...

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: Eliwood, Hector, I understand how you both feel. But without these weapons, we won’t be able to stop Nergal. ...You know that, don’t you?

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: ...Yes. When next I wield it, ...I won’t hesitate.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Confidence is just a matter of time. I’ll use it when I need to. You’ll see, Graybeard!

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: I know.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: ...Oswin.

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: I’m here, Lord Hector. We won’t be able to contact Fargus about traveling to Valor ’til the day after tomorrow. The guards are rotating watches to protect the castle. Lord Hector. For this one night, please get some rest.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Who needs rest!? Do not talk to me of rest when Ostia needs me! There is...something that you need to tell me, isn’t there?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: I can think of nothing, my lord.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Stop this foolishness!! It’s plain that everyone is avoiding me! What you’re all hiding... I know what it is!

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Lord Hector, you must calm yourself.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Say it! I command you!! Tell me what has happened!!!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: ...If you don’t answer right here, right now, I will cut you down, knave!

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: ...Do as you must.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: ......I...see. ...My brother... He’s...gone...isn’t he?

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Lord Hector!!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: I was sure... He was recuperating... That he’d gone somewhere to recover his strength. I thought that was what you were hiding... But......you won’t confess even now. ......That means......

end.speaker: Oswin
end.line: Lord Hector! Wait!! Please......!!!

end.speaker: Limstella
end.line: Welcome home, Master.

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: Limstella, look at this.

end.speaker: Limstella
end.line: The children’s dragon stone. What will you do with it?

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: I will infuse it with quintessence.

end.speaker: Limstella
end.line: This is...

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: The dragon girl... Ninian’s essence. Beautiful... Absolutely beautiful...... With this, I will be able to call dragons whenever I please.

end.speaker: Limstella
end.line: Shall we begin the process right away?

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: No, I lost some quintessence from the injuries I took from Athos. To summon the numbers I need, I must have more essence. One must be fully prepared when dealing with dragons. If they wrested free from my control and killed me, all would be for naught.

end.speaker: Limstella
end.line: I fear to report... that the quintessence from the Black Fang has all been used. Where shall the next harvest come from?

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: Heh heh heh... All the materials we need are heading this way even now.

end.speaker: Limstella
end.line: ...I see. Eliwood and friends.

end.speaker: Nergal
end.line: That’s right. I will crush them, steal their essences, and call forth my dragons!! Heh heh heh... Haaa haa haha haha hah!!!
